docs.title: setup_postgres_db_in_docker
docs.text:
STEP 1: CREATE THE CONTAINER

docker run --name bookly_db \
  -e POSTGRES_USER=samuel \
  -e POSTGRES_PASSWORD=8446vinald \
  -e POSTGRES_DB=booklydb \
  -v demo_pg_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data \
  -p 5432:5432 \
  -d postgres


==============================================================================
What this does:
    •   Container name: bookly_db
    •   Database name: booklydb
    •   Username: samuel
    •   Password: 8446vinald
    •   Port mapping: Makes Postgres accessible on your local port 5432
    •   Volume: demo_pg_data ensures your data persists even if the container stops or is removed.
==============================================================================



STEP 2: CHECK THAT THE CONTAINER IS RUNNING

docker ps


==============================================================================


STEP 3: CONNECT TO THE DATABASE INSIDE THE CONTAINER

docker exec -it bookly_db psql -U samuel -d booklydb


==============================================================================


STEP 3: CONNECT TO THE CONTAINER TO APP/GUI
Use these connection details:
    •   Host: localhost
    •   Port: 5432
    •   Database: booklydb
    •   Username: samuel
    •   Password: 8446vinald

==============================================================================


INSPECT CONTAINER LOGS
docker logs bookly_db


==============================================================================


APP CONNECTION STRING

Python
postgresql://samuel:8446vinald@localhost:5432/booklydb


==============================================================================


ENVIRONMENT VARIABLE
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://samuel:8446vinald@localhost:5432/booklydb


SUMMARY
Action
Command / Detail
Run container
Docker run --name bookly_db ... (already done)
Connect inside container
docker exec -it bookly_db psql -U samuel -d booklydb
Connect from GUI/app
Host=localhost, Port=5432, DB=booklydb, User=samuel, Password=8446vinald
Check logs
docker logs bookly_db
Connection string
postgresql://Samuel:8446vinald@localhost:5432/booklydb

#GitIgnore File
# Byte-compiled / optimized / DLL files

*.py[cod]
*$py.class
*.so

# Virtual environment directories
.venv/
venv/
ENV/
env/

.allenv/
allenv/

# macOS files
.DS_Store
.AppleDouble

# Documentation

# Flask and Django

*.sqlite3
db.sqlite3-journal

# PyInstaller

# Jupyter Notebook

# IPython

# TypeScript

# Vim swap files
*~

docs.title: ssh_key_setup
docs.text:
ls -al ~/.ssh
ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "okiror1vinald@gmail.com"
eval $(ssh-agent -s)
ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_rsa
cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub
#create ssh key on the github
ssh -T git@github.com
git config --global user.name "[vinald]"
git config --global user.email "okiror1vinald@gmail.com"
git clone git@github.com:username/repository.git

docs.title: env
docs.text:
venv - create and use virtual environment
--------------------------------------------------------------

## linux

sudo apt install python3 python3-venv
python3 -m venv allenv
source allenv/bin/activate
pip install package_name
deactivate

## windows

cd C:\Users\YourUsername\Projects
python3 -m venv allenv
myenv\Scripts\activate
pip install package_name
deactivate
